∞’amidah

Ez. 1:24

The ש‹Shyn› of the phylacteries381 – this is Higher Mother.
Upon Her it is stated: {Deut. 28:10}And all the peoples of the land shall see,
that the Name of YQV”Q is called upon you, and they shall fear you.

Shyn

Deut. 28:10

The letters of the word ShYN‹ש› add up to 360,
with Hei‹ה›‹5› of ‘the weak-hand’ totals 365,
and the 248 precepts,
which are included in the 248 words of the recitation of the Shm’a,
in the four382 portions of the Shm’a,
makes 613.
Upon them it is stated: {Ex. 3:15}This is My Name for ever,
and this is My remembrance for every generation.

ש

ה 5

Ex. 3:15

ShMY ∞‹∞My Name›‹r350› with Y-Q‹r15› is 365,
ZiKhRY ∞‹∞My remembrance›‹r237› with V-Q‹r11› is 248,
and all is 613∞‹∞TaRYaG›.383
The Torah is the Name of the blessed Holy One.

∞My Name r350 r15

∞My remembrance r237 r11

∞TaRYaG

And furthermore:
the tzitzit ∞‹∞tassels› is a throne.
Tephilin∞‹∞phylacteries› is the blessed Holy One
Who descends upon the throne,
when they call upon Him in the recitation of the Shm’a.
Then the blessed Holy One sits upon the throne!
They must then rise because of Him in the ‘standing’ prayer.
Then Her three hosts arrive,
in hymns, songs and praises.384

∞tassels

∞phylacteries

At the time when He is upon the throne,
what do they say? [Var. it is written of it:]
‘EL, the King, sitting upon the throne of mercy,
and acting with kindness . . . ’ xlix

This tiqun,385 is for the completely righteous,
who fix a throne for the blessed Holy One with the tzitzit,
and lower Him with the phylacteries,386
and stand before Him in prayer.387

For average people,388
tzitzit and tephilin
are like an ox to the yoke, and a donkey to its burden.
And on the Sabbath, it is stated of them:
{Ex. 23:12} . . . in order that your ox and your donkey should rest . . .

Ex. 23:12

For the wicked,
they are a binding to all their prosecutors.

For thus there are ten ‘lower crowns’, because
‘one corresponding to the other did the blessed Holy One create’.389
But the ‘lower crowns’ are husks, in relation to the higher crowns,
in which the ten letters390 are enclothed
[in prayer∞‹∞tzlota›] [Var. in exile∞‹∞galuta›],391
in order that ‘the lower crowns’ be subjugated beneath it.

∞tzlota ∞galuta

And when the righteous ‘perform tiqun’,
with the ‘wings of precept’,392 and with phylacteries,
the ‘lower crowns’ become subjugated393 beneath them,
[Var. The King is arriving!]
Then, the King enters His chamber, which is ADNY,
like this: Y-A-Q-D-V-N-Q-Y.

Behold, the King is in His chamber!
One who wishes to ask his request, should enter,
and because of this: {Ps. 51:17}ADNY! Open my lips!

Ps. 51:17

In the first three blessings of the ‘standing’ prayer,
a person should organise his praise,
like a servant who organises his praise before his Master.
For these three blessings write all merit,
and the final three blessings seal them.

And because of this, a person should become, through them,
like ‘a servant who receives a reward from his master,394 and leaves’,
for it is there in the final blessing that there is a ‘receptacle’395
– ‘the seal of the binding’396 [Var. ‘seal of truth’] –
and She is the holy Malkhut.

During the intermediate blessings, one needs to request,
for ו-ו‹Vav Vav› is there
– one represents the Masters of Writing,
and one represents the Masters of Sealing.
And they are Higher Vav‹6› and lower Vav‹6›,
incorporating 12 parts.

Vav-Vav

6 6

Three first ones – the head and two arms,
three latter ones – the body and two thighs.397

Then he retires from [the presence of] the King.
Because of this, one needs to give [Var. retreat398]
three steps backwards.l399
And the mystery of the word:
. . . {Gen. 49:33}and he gathered his feet to the bed . . .

Gen. 49:33

Tiqun Eleven,400 For Day 7

Be-REiShYT∞‹∞In the beginning› can be read as two words:
BaRA∞‹∞He-created› ShYT∞‹∞six›.401
And what are they?
Six chambers.402 [corresponding to the six days of creation],
ELQYM – Higher Mother – is above them,403
for She is the seventh chamber.

26b

∞In the beginning

∞He-created ∞six

And just as Higher Mother produces six,
so does lower Mother produce six.
And what are they?
{Gen. 1:1} . . . the heavens and the earth.
And they are six vessels404 of which it is stated:
{Ex. 20:11}For in six days did Y”Y make the heavens and the earth . . .
And the lower chambers are vessels for the higher chambers.

Gen. 1:1

Ex. 20:11

And when Israel would pray,405
all these chambers would open towards them.

But now, during the exile, it is statedli of them,
that all the gates are closed,
and the Shekhinah is outside Her chamber,
and the Blessed Holy One is outside His chamber.406
And the angels appointed over prayer are outside their chambers.
It is this that is written:
{Is. 33:7}Behold their mighty ones are shouting outside . . .
And there is no place for prayers to ascend.

Is. 33:7

And this is the meaning of ‘all the gates are closed,
but the gates of tears are not closed.’

And there is none who can open these gates,
until the ‘Master of Tears’407 shall arrive,
of whom it is stated: {Ex. 2:6}And she opened, and she saw the boy,
and behold, it was a crying child . . .
 – and no chamber can be opened except by him.

Ex. 2:6

And this is the meaning of . . . and she opened . . .
. . . and she opened . . . – specifically [Var. there became opened]
– a chamber towards him
[it is this that is written: ADNY! Open my lips].
With what did it open for him?
With tears.408
It is this that is written: . . . and behold, a crying child . . .
And immediately: she took pity upon him.

And furthermore: regarding . . . and she opened . . .
When Israel begins repentance in crying,
then immediately: . . . and she took pity upon him . . .
And this is: {Jer. 31:8}With crying they shall come . . .
 – with the merit of his crying [Var. tear],
they will be gathered from exile.
[BeKhiY∞r ‹∞crying›‹r32› is LeV ∞r ‹∞heart›‹r32›,
Yod‹r10› is ‘tear’, ‘daughter of the eye’ is the small י‹Yod›]

Jer. 31:8

∞crying r32 ∞heart r32

r10 Yod

For there is a Chamber of Tears,409
for which there is no permission to open,
except through tears.

And there is a Chamber of Music,410
for which there is no permission to open except through music.
And because of this,
David would approach that chamber with music.
It is this that is written:
{2 King. 3:15} . . . and it was, when the player of music played . . . 411

2 King. 3:15

And there is a Chamber of Light,412
that opens only for a person who,
is occupied in ‘the light of the Torah’.413

And there is a Chamber of Prophecy414 [Var. of love]415
that opens only for a person who,
is ‘wise, mighty and wealthy.’lii

And there is a Chamber of Awe,
which is called ‘the Chamber of Awe’,416
which does not open except for one who has ‘fear’.417

And there is a Chamber of the Poor,418
which opens only to the poor,
who enwrap themselves before Y”Y in prayer,
[in the enwrapping of precept, of tzitzit and phylacteries∞‹∞tephilin›]
And upon them it is stated: {Ps. 102:1}
A prayer ∞‹∞tephilah› of the poor person when he enwraps . . .

And why was It the Shekhinah revealed to him in a bush?
To show that She was oppressed among the thorns,428
and nevertheless, . . . and the bush was not consumed . . .

– which are Her children,429 who are Israel –
who are destined to be in exile amongst the mixed multitude,430
who are ‘thorns’.431

∞ khalah

[Var. of the Shekhinah].

∞kalah

And the oppression of Israel by the mixed multitude in exile,
hastens the redemption for them,
while their easing of exilic conditions
prolongs the redemption for Israel.

And therefore, it the angel appeared to Moses,
in ‘the flame of the fire’
from the midst of the bush, from within thorns.434

When he approached there to see this activity,
the Holy One Blessed be He said to him:
{Ex. 3:5} . . . do not approach here, remove your shoes . . .

Ex. 3:5

Here He alluded, that he Moses should shed his body,
which was ‘a shoe’∞‹∞na’al› relative to the other body,
in which he became enclothed when he approached.435

∞na’al

And there is one who says that it the shoe is his wife.436
And it is all truth: this opinion and that.

that the Temple, which is built by humans,

by the hand of the blessed Holy One.

one is my help is from Y”Y,

and your speech is beautiful . . .
Behold two types of music in which King David offered praise:
with ashrei ∞‹∞fortunate›, with shyr ∞‹∞song›.475

Song. 4:3

∞fortunate ∞song

The third is with ‘blessing’∞‹∞brakhah›
– and this is Higher Shekhinah.
And about Her it is stated: {Ps. 103:1}Let my soul bless Y”Y . . .
From this is a person given the ‘soul-breath∞‹∞nishmat› of life’.

∞brakhah

Ps. 103:1

∞nishmat

For it is stated of it the soul five constructs:lxii

Just as the blessed Holy One sustains the whole world,
so does the soul sustain the whole body.
Just as the blessed Holy One sees but is not seen,
so the soul sees but is not seen,
Just as the blessed Holy One dwells in the innermost chambers,
so does the soul dwell in the innermost chambers,
Just as the blessed Holy One fills the whole world
[Var. the earth of His glory],
so does the soul fill the whole body,
Just as the blessed Holy One judges the whole world,
so does the soul judge the body.476

And the mystery of the soul being equal to the blessed Holy One:
it is Binah also referred to as MiY ∞‹∞Who›.477
And about Her it is stated:
{Is. 40:25}And to whom ∞‹∞MiY› will you liken Me, that I may be compared?
. . . to MiY∞‹∞whom›‹Binah›, specifically!
And behold the Masters of the Mishnah478 established479
these five things,
five specifically,480 because they are of the aspect of Higher Hei‹ה›‹5›.

∞Who

Is. 40:25

∞MiY

∞whom Binah

ה 5

And they are all constructs of the heart,
as the Masters of the Mishnah have established:lxiii
the heart understands,481 the heart sees, the heart hears.
Behold three!
Hei‹ה› it actually482 is [Var. breath].
And the ‘spirit-wind∞‹∞ruḥa› of the mouth’,483
through which ascend voice, and utterance and speech,
– this is Vav ‹ו›,484
the arteries485 of the heart are like soldiers following their King.

ה

∞ruḥa

ו

And the mystery of the matter:
{Ez. 1:12}To wherever the ‘spirit’ ∞‹∞ruaḥ› was to go, they would go . . .
Thus, do the arteries of the heart behave in relation to the spirit [like with those above].
Behold you have the wind∞‹∞ruaḥ› in the heart,
which emerges from the left ‘ear’486 of the heart,
it was ‘the northern wind that strummed upon David’s harp.’lxiv
And with this spirit did he strum the five strings of the harp,
which are the five ‘wings’ nodes of the lung.

Ez. 1:12

∞ruaḥ

∞ruaḥ

And through the windpipe, does voice ascend to487 the heart.
And it is a consuming fire from the right ‘ear’ of the heart,
which is opposite the liver,
and from which emerges speech.
It is this that is written: {Jer. 23:29}Is not My word thus like fire?
And if not for the nodes of the lung blowing upon the heart,
it would burn up the whole body.488

Jer. 23:29

‘Thought’ is in the heart
– and this is Yod‹י›.

י

For Hei-Hei‹הה› are utterance and speech.
Vav‹ו› – the voice – incorporates all.

ה־ה

ו

The fourth type of music is with ‘hymn’∞‹∞mizmor›
– and this is the right arm.
It is this that is written: {Ps. 98:1}A hymn: Sing to Y”Y! A new song!
For He has done wonders, His right hand has saved . . .
And about that is stated: {Ps. 60:7} . . . Save with Your right-hand!

∞mizmor

Ps. 98:1

Ps. 60:7

And it the right-hand of YQV”Q is in exile with the Shekhinah,489
and It supports Her.
And the mystery of the word is: {Is. 53:1}And the arm of Y”Y
– upon whom has it been revealed?

Is. 53:1

And through it is the promise of redemption.
It is this that is written: {Is. 62:8}Y”Y has sworn by His right-hand,
and by His arm of strength . . .
And furthermore:490 {Ruth 3:13} . . . as Y”Y lives, lie down until the morning.

Is. 62:8

Ruth 3:13

And why is it called the ‘arm of Y”Y’?
Because the palm of the hand has within it a י‹Yod› [Var. YOD‹יו״ד›],
the five fingers are Hei‹ה›‹5›,
the windpipe of the right, which is the arm, Vav‹ו›,
the shoulder has within it Hei‹ה›.
And this is ‘the Middle Pillar’‹Tipheret›,
which is bound with the right,
to raise up the Shekhinah in exile.

Yod יו״ד

ה 5

ו

ה

Tipheret

And of Moses,
who is the image of the Middle Pillar,
it is stated: {Is. 63:12}He leads to the right of Moses, the arm of His glory ∞‹∞Tipheret› . . .
And He ‘splits’ the waters of the Torah,491
towards the seed of Abraham, who is the right-hand side,
to be for him . . . an eternal Name . . .

Is. 63:12

∞Tipheret

And he Moses is bound with the Hei‹5› of AbraHam,492
which is the five books of the Torah,
and through which is perfected the name of Moses∞‹∞ MoSheH›.
And as soon as it his name is perfected,
the right-hand is revealed upon him.
And this is:
{Is. 53:1} . . . and the arm of Y”Y, upon whom has it been revealed?

At that time:
the mystery of the Mishnah499 will be fulfilled,
which says:lxvi ‘One may eat the whole of the four hours,
and keep it in suspense all the fifth . . . ’
– which is the fifth millennium –
‘ . . . and burn it at the beginning of the sixth hour’,
– which is ‘the sixth millennium’.500

And in order that they not separate
between ‘the six’ ∞‹∞shesh›, which is the Middle Pillar,
and ‘the seven’, which is its coupling partner,
one needs to destroy the yeast and the leaven,
which are the mixed multitude,
for they must not be seen,
between six – which is Vav‹ו›‹6› –
and seven, of which it is stated:
{Ps. 119:164}Seven times in the day I praise you . . .

∞shesh

ו 6

Ps. 119:164

Because the mixed multitude separated between ‘six’ and ‘seven’,
at the Giving of the Torah,
as it says: {Ex. 32:1}And the People saw that Moses delayed ∞‹∞vo-shesh› . . .
And they the sages established lxvii that vo-shesh means ‘in six’∞‹∞ba-shesh›
– in these six hours they made the golden calf,
and they separated between Vav‹ו›‹6› and Qei‹ה›‹5›,
which are between six to seven.
So will the blessed Holy One separate them,
between the sixth millennium and the seventh.

Ex. 32:1

∞vo-shesh

∞ba-shesh

ו 6 ה 5

For because of them, She Shekhinah was
as ‘a broken unleavened-bread’,501
{Deut. 16:3} . . . the bread of poverty . . .
Poverty, specifically!

Deut. 16:3

And at that time the future,
She will be whole, like Her companion,502
Who is a ‘complete unleavened-bread’.
It is this that is written: {Is. 30:26}
And the light of the moon shall be as the light of the sun . . .

Is. 30:26

And why was She a broken unleavened-bread?
Because ו‹Vav›, Her leg, had withdrawn or ascended from Her,
thus preventing Her from being like a precept∞‹∞mitzvah›.
And a broken unleavened-bread remains a Dalet∞‹ד›‹∞poor›503
and because of that:
The ‘broken’ MaTzaH is ד‹Dalet›
A ‘complete’ MaTzaH is ה‹Hei›

Vav

∞mitzvah

ד ∞poor

Dalet

Hei

And because of this,
we say both a complete Hallel,
and a Hallel that is not complete, on the Passover,
corresponding to: ‘complete matzah and broken matzah.

And we talk about the bitter herb∞‹∞maror›,504
because of the Vav‹ו› that became separated from the Hei‹ה›.505
And this caused for them: {Ex. 1:14}And they embittered ∞‹∞va-yemare-ru› their lives.
He became maror ∞‹∞bitter herb› and She became marah∞‹∞bitter›.
It is this that is written: {Ruth 1:20} . . . call me bitter ∞‹∞marah›,506
because ShaDaY has embittered ∞‹∞heimar› me greatly.
{Ex. 1:14} . . . with harsh ∞‹∞qashah› servitude . . .

. . . with mortar ∞‹∞ḥomer› . . .

when they are among the nations of the world.507

which Moses gave the mixed multitude.508

י

Because of this, Moses was lowered from his level.
It is this that is written: {

Your people and not “My people.”

Ex. 32:7

And by his Moses’ hand,
the Shekhinah is destined to be united with the blessed Holy One,
because he separated them, he needs to unite them
– to fix what he had done wrong.509

All the companions rose and kissed him,
and they each said:
‘If we had not come to the world except to hear this,
it would have been enough.’

The seventh type of music is with ‘conducting’ ∞‹∞nitzu-aḥ›,
which is The Eternal ∞‹∞netzaḥ› of Israel.
And about it is stated:

And it is Netzaḥ which is upon it.

29a

And Hod is the eight days of the festival of Ḥanukah,
after twenty-four days of Kislev, which are the 24 letters of:
‘Blessed is the Name of the glory of His Kingdom for ever and ever’.

And immediately when {Gen. 8:11} . . . a torn off olive leaf in its mouth . . .

and these are ‘the twenty-five letters of unity’,
which are {Deut. 6:4}Hear O Israel . . . etc.
And this is Ḥanu-kah

∞tzadiq

And through it ‹Hod›: {Gen. 7:19}And the waters greatly prevailed . . .
When Israel does not observe the covenant of circumcision,
the nations of the world prevail,513[who are ‘the raging waters’514],
but when they observe it, it is stated of them:

until the tenth month . . . – this is the Yod of circumcision,
which is Malkhut, tenth of the ten sephirot.

And of Ya’AQoV ∞‹∞Jacob›515

For Yod had flown away from him,

Gen. 3:15

When the tabernacle is completed with its ‘thigh’,
it is stated of Jacob: {Gen. 33:18}And Jacob arrived complete . . .
And Jacob, specifically, is the image of the Middle Pillar,
from the outside aspect.
And behold Moses was there, but he was from the inside aspect
– this one of the body, this one of the soul.
And therefore, the two thighs of the Middle Pillar are complete,
they are Netzaḥ and Hod.

Gen. 33:18

And when will the Middle Pillar be complete?
When it becomes joined with the Shekhinah.
It is this that is written: {Gen. 33:17}And Jacob travelled to Sukkot,
and he built for himself a house . . .
It is this that is written: {Gen. 2:22} . . . and Y”Y ELQYM built the rib . . .

Gen. 33:17

Gen. 2:22

At that time, when He is joined with Her,
{Gen. 33:18}And Jacob arrived complete . . .
At that time: the tabernacle∞‹∞SUKaH› will be complete,
composed of K-U‹כו›‹r26› H-S‹הס›‹65›: Y-A-Q-D-V-N-Q-Y.

Gen. 33:18

∞SUKaH

כו r26 הס 65

Arose Rabbi El’azar and said:
‘Father! Father!
Why is it stated of the first day of the Festival of Tabernacles∞‹∞Sukkot›:
{Lev. 23:40}And you shall take for yourselves, on the first day,
the fruit of a stately tree . . . ?’

∞Sukkot

Lev. 23:40

He said to him: ‘My son,
one takes the weapons of war in the right hand,516
and with these weapons of war,
Israel are inscribed as victorious in judgement.’

A parable of a king,
who had dispute and war with the ‘seventy nations’,
and no-one knew who had won the dispute.
And they asked him the king: ‘who was victorious in the dispute?’
He said: ‘Look at those who are depicted,517
with weapons of war in their hands,
and you will know who has won the dispute.’lxviii

And you shall take for yourselves, on the first day,
the fruit of a stately tree . . . – this is the citron∞‹∞etrog›,
which is the Shekhinah,518 the heart,lxix
which is the primary of all the limbs of the body,
which are three strands of myrtle∞‹∞hadas›,
and the palm-branch∞‹∞lulav›,
and two strands of willow∞‹∞’aravah›
– the heart is in the middle,
and the limbs are round about it.
And thus, the etrog is the Shekhinah.

∞etrog

∞hadas

∞lulav

∞’aravah

And thus did the sages of the Mishnah establish:lxx
‘If its peduncle519 [Var. its nipple520] was removed,
and if scarring521 had risen over most of it, it is unfit,’
– because it the etrog is like the Shekhinah,
of which it is stated: {Song. 4:7}All of you is beautiful, my beloved,
and there is no defect in ‘her’ you.522

Song. 4:7

Date-palm fronds – this is the lulav.
And upon it is stated:lxxi ‘if its leaves are separated, it is unfit’,
because he is one who ‘cuts off the shoots’523
[for behold the lulav is the binding and the unity of all]
whoever makes a blessing over it such a lulav
on the first day of Sukkot.524
Because it the lulav is the binding and unity of all,
the ‘ḥaiy ∞‹∞life-force›‹r18› of the worlds’,
which corresponds to the 18∞‹∞ḥaiy› vertebrae of the spine.525
And because of this, the sages of the Mishnah established:lxxii
‘the lulav∞‹∞palm-branch› is like a spine.’

∞life-force r18

∞ḥaiy

∞palm-branch

And the mystery of the lulav is:
{Ps. 92:13}The righteous shall flourish like a palm . . .
And this is: {1 Chron. 29:11} . . . for everything ∞‹∞khol›‹Yesod› in the heavens and earth . . .
And Onqelos526 translated this as: ‘grasping527 heaven and earth.’

Ps. 92:13

1 Chron. 29:11

∞khol Yesod

And one is required to wave the lulav 18∞‹∞ḥaiy› wavings
in six directions,528 which are:
‘the sealing [Var. sealed] [Var. formed]
of the East with Y-Q-V etc.’
– six HVYHs, in which there are eighteen letters,
and all are alluded to in ‘The Book of Creation,’ lxxiii
in six sides.

∞ḥaiy

And thus did the sages of the Mishnah establish:lxxiv
‘one brings back and forth’,
to Whom the four winds of the earth belong,
‘one raises and lowers’
to Whom the heavens and the earth belong.

The tree myrtle leaves are the body and two arms,
and they correspond to the eye and two ‘wings’ of the eye eyelids.
The two strands of willow correspond to the two thighs,
and they correspond to the two lips.

And when they are all one bunch,
with the lulav, which is the spine,
what is written? {Song. 7:9}I said: ‘I shall ascend’ ∞‹∞E-’ELeH› the palm . . . acronym of:
Aleph‹א› is the Etrog ∞‹∞citron›,
’Ayin‹ע› is the ‘Aravah ∞‹∞willow›,
Lamed‹ל› is the Lulav∞‹∞palm-branch ›,
Hei‹ה› is the Hadass ∞‹∞myrtle›.
All are made [to correspond to] the four ‘species’ of the chariot.
The One who rides upon them is YQV”Q.

Song. 7:9

∞E-’ELeH

א ∞citron

ע ∞willow

ל ∞palm-branch

ה ∞myrtle

And one needs to arrange, with them, in perambulation,529
like that of the altar.
And for the sake of what?
For the sake of the garden in which these plants are planted.

29b

And the mystery of the matter:
{Jer. 31:21} . . . a female ∞‹∞neqevah› shall encompass a man∞‹∞gaver›.
Neqevah∞‹∞female› is Nun‹נ› from GaN ∞‹∞garden›,
Gaver∞‹∞man› is Gimmel‹ג› from GaN.
GaN‹53› comprises the fifty-three portions of the Written Torah.530
And together with, the seven days of Sukkot, behold they are sixty,
corresponding to ‘the sixty’ tractates of the Talmud.

Jer. 31:21

∞neqevah ∞gaver

∞female נ ∞garden

∞man ג

53

The ‘Eighth Day of Assembly’,531
is a festival unto itself,lxxv
in it is the well-spring of the Torah,532
which irrigates the tree which is planted in the garden,
and its roots and its branches are like {Is. 40:22} . . . the circle ∞‹∞ḥug› of the Earth . . .
in which all the festivals∞‹∞ḥagin› become celebrated.533

Is. 40:22

∞ḥug

∞ḥagin

The ninth [type of music] is ‘joy’ ∞‹∞rinah›.
And this is {Ps. 33:1}Rejoice ∞‹∞rane-nu› O righteous ones in Y”Y.
And this is the level of the Righteous One‹Yesod›,
the ḥaiy ∞‹∞life-force› of the worlds.
From there, comes joy – and through it is redemption!
It is this that is written: {Jer. 23:5} . . . the righteous plant ∞‹∞tzemaḥ› . . .
{Zech. 6:12} . . . and from beneath him it will sprout ∞‹∞yitzmaḥ› . . .
Beneath him, specifically – that which is ‘the tenth’ of everything‹Malkhut›.

∞rinah

Ps. 33:1

∞rane-nu

Yesod

∞life-force

Jer. 23:5

∞tzemaḥ

Zech. 6:12

∞yitzmaḥ

Malkhut

And ‘the Righteous One’‹Yesod› takes from the left,
and ‘the Middle Pillar’‹Tipheret› from the right.
It is this that is written:
{Deut. 33:2} . . . from His right-hand a fiery law 534 for them.535

Yesod

Tipheret

Deut. 33:2

[ALePh QE YOD QE, YOD QE VAV QE, YOD QY VYV QY,
YOD QY VAV QY, ALePh QE VAV QE, YOD QQ VV QQ,
ALePh DaLeT NUN YOD]

At that time:
when the two Names536 are as one,
the daughter of the King will be aroused,
through Song of Songs and Proverbs and Ecclesiastes,537
which are {1 King. 5:12} . . . three thousand parables . . .
three Yods,
which are the three ‘drops’ of the brain538
which descend from Yod‹י› [Var. Vav‹ו›],
and to where are they extended?
Towards ‘the Righteous One’‹Yesod›, who is the rainbow of the covenant,
and that which was small is made large.539

1 King. 5:12

י ו

Yesod

And the mystery of the matter:
the cantillation notes shophar holekh 540 – large pazer.
When will an arrow be shooting?
When it is in this form: ֡ ‹pazer›.541

pazer

Opened542 Rabbi Shimon a discourse and said:
O higher ones!
Prepare yourselves and make haste,
with weapons of war against the snake,543
who nests in the great mountains,
and who killed the first man,
and all generations that were after him!

And because of this, an announcement goes out every day:
‘whoever kills that snake,
which nests in the great mountains,
will be given the daughter of the King’544
– which is prayer –
for he sits upon a tower,
of which it is stated: {Prov. 18:10}A tower of strength is the Name of Y”Y,
the righteous shall run into it and be strengthened.

Prov. 18:10

Meanwhile, the Faithful Shepherd∞‹∞Ra’aya Me-heimna› Moses arrived,
with many sheep and oxen and goats,
and a staff 545 in his hand.
He raised his eyes to the tower,
and there came [Var. he saw] a young man
– Righteous One∞‹∞tzadiq› is his name –
who was sitting upon the tower with a bow in his hand,
and he was shooting arrows towards the snake,
and this is ‘the great ֡ pazer’.

∞Ra’aya Me-heimna

∞tzadiq

But the snake did not even notice them.

And the bow is the tongue of the mouth,
the ‘nut of the bow’546 is the mouth,
the thread of scarlet [this is the lip] [Var. of the lip],
the cord of the bow [Var. Ḥesed],
through which the righteous man was shooting arrows
– which are the utterances of prayer –
towards the snake.

But the snake did not even notice them.

And not because of the weakness,
of the Righteous One, ‘life-force of the worlds’,
but because of the weakness,
of he that was shooting them,
– who is ‘the righteous one’ below Him,
[Var. the righteous one who is outside of Him],
when he is incomplete,
and because of this it the snake did not notice them the arrows.

Until the Faithful Shepherd arrived,
and took one arrow and shot towards it,
again and again,547 with his prayer,
{Prov. 7:23}until an arrow splits his liver – of the snake.

Prov. 7:23

For it is Samael – ‘another god’548 –
and there in the liver is its fundament and essence.
And because of this: ‘the liver gets angry’.lxxvi
With what does it get angry?
With the bile∞‹∞marah›549 that cleaves to it,
and this is the ‘poison of death’ 550 – his female counterpart,
his tail, the ‘extra lobe’ of the liver.
‘Extra’ she is called,
for after she performs her adulteries,
she gives the remains to her husband.

∞marah

And the tail is his maidservant [Var. messenger].
With the bile he angers, and with the tail he kills.
The bitter bile is his face,
the extra lobe is his tail.

Like Adam,
for whom was made a face and then a tail.551
For this one is called ‘the evil∞‹∞r’a› Adam’.552
And this one is like that one,
except that this is the man that was taken from the tree of life,
and this is the man that was taken from the tree of death.

∞r’a

After the arrow penetrates its liver,
seed ‘shoots like an arrow’553 towards the bride.
Yod‹י› is the seed∞‹∞zer’a› that is drawn from it,
and this is a Zayin‹ז›.554
And it is stated of it: {1 Sam. 20:20} . . . as though I shot at a target,
– and this is the ‘the eye’s daughter’∞‹∞bat ’ayin›,
a receptacle for zer‘a∞‹∞seed›,
which is most certainly the letter ז‹Zayin›.

י ∞zer’a

ז

1 Sam. 20:20

∞bat ’ayin

∞seed

Zayin

What is the ‘target’∞‹∞matarah›?
This is the cantillation note yeraḥ ∞‹∞moon› ֪ ben yomo∞‹∞ a-day-old›
– the holy moon.
She is most certainly a target for the ‘the eye’s daughter’,
a small point inside,
towards which he sends arrows,
with the ‘love of the eyes’.555

∞matarah

∞moon ∞ a-day-old

A ‘protector’∞‹∞matarah› the Shekhinah surely is,556
which protects Israel,
from the evil snake Samael.
And of the one

∞matarah

Whom She protects,
it is stated of it: {Ps. 91:5}You shall not fear the terror of the night,
nor the arrow that flies by day,
{Ps. 91:4}With his limb ∞‹∞evrato› He will cover you . . .
 – this is ‘the limb’∞‹∞eiver› of ‘the living’∞‹∞ha-ḥaiy›,557
– the Righteous One‹Yesod›.

30a

Ps. 91:5

Ps. 91:4

∞evrato

∞eiver ∞ha-ḥaiy

Yesod

Ps. 91:4

{Ps. 91:4} . . . and beneath His wings you will take shelter . . .
these are Hei-Hei‹הה›,
for the letter Zayin‹ז› is a Vav‹ו› which is his limb . . .
comprised of Yod-Vav‹יו›,
its body is ו‹Vav›,
its head is י‹Yod›,
its wings are ה־ה‹Hei Hei›,
and thus: beneath His wings you will take shelter . . .

ה־ה

ז ו

יו

Vav

Yod

Hei-Hei

ibid

{ibid} . . . shield and armour is His truth,
shield and armour are Higher‹Binah› and the lower‹Malkhut› Shekhinah,
His truth – this is the Middle Pillar‹Tipheret›,
its head is Higher Ḥokhmah.
The Righteous One‹Yesod› is in His image, like His likeness.

Binah Malkhut

Tipheret

Yesod

Worthy is the one who keeps the covenant of circumcision‹Yesod›,
and the Torah, which is the Middle Pillar‹Tipheret›,
because both-of-them protect him:
one in this world, and one in the world that is coming.

Yesod

Tipheret

Tiqun Fourteen558

Gen. 1:1

{Gen. 1:1}Be-REiYShYT∞‹∞In the beginning›
Upon it is stated:{Ex. 23:19}The first ∞‹∞reishyt› of the first-fruits of your land,
you shall bring to the house of Y”Y ELoQeYKha,
you shall not cook a kid in its mother’s milk.

∞In the beginning

Ex. 23:19

∞reishyt

Come and see:
It is stated about higher Ḥokhmah ∞‹∞wisdom›:559
{Ex. 13:2}Sanctify to Me every firstborn . . .
For all ‘first-fruits’ ∞‹∞bikkurim› are called for its sake:
and from there the Shekhinah is called ‘first born’ ∞‹∞be-khorah›.
It is Ḥokhmah, specifically, upon which it is stated:
{Ez. 44:30} . . . the ‘first’ of everything, the first fruits of everything . . .

∞wisdom

Ex. 13:2

∞bikkurim

∞be-khorah

Ez. 44:30

And Her first born son is ‘the first’ of everything,
– this is Vav‹ו›, the Middle Pillar.
{Ex. 23:19}The first of the fruits of your land . . .
 – the two pillars of truth.
What is “your land”?
It is the lower Shekhinah.
And they are . . . all, the first fruits of everything . . .
 – from the aspect of the Righteous One,
Who is ‘all’ ∞‹∞kol›.560

ו

Ex. 23:19

∞kol

And the Shekhinah is the earth,
in which trees grow and flourish,
about which it is stated: {Jer. 23:5} . . . a righteous sprout . . .
which is {Gen. 1:11}a fruit tree.

Jer. 23:5

Gen. 1:11

A great and mighty tree is the Middle Pillar,
herbs and grasses, who are the sages,561
sprout from there like a garden,562
because563 She is the Oral Torah.

And what waters and irrigates [Var. and multiplies], with it,
the trees and the herbs and the grasses?
{Song. 4:15}the well-spring of the gardens – which is Ḥokhmah,
the first of everything, the first born of all.
And from where does the well-spring of water emerge?
From ‘the house of Y”Y’.
It is this that is written: {Joel 4:18} . . . and a well-spring shall go forth,
from the House of Y”Y . . .

Song. 4:15

Joel 4:18

And because of this: {Ex. 23:19}The ‘first’ ∞‹∞reishyt› of the fruits of your land,
you shall bring to the house of Y”Y ELoQeYKha.
And similarly, with ‘the first’ of goats and sheep.
It is this that is written: {Deut. 18:4} . . . and the first of the fleece of your flock,
you shall give to Him.
And next to: . . . the first of the first fruits of your land . . . etc.,
it is written {Ex. 23:19} . . . do not cook a kid in its mother’s milk . . .
What is one to do with the other?

Ex. 23:19

∞reishyt

Deut. 18:4

Ex. 23:19

Arose564 Rabbi Shimon upon his feet.
He opened with a loud voice and said:
‘Elijah! Elijah!
Descend here with permission of your Master,
and enlighten the eyes of these elders, on that matter,
so that they should not come to eat meat with milk!’565

Meanwhile, Elijah descended and did not delay.
He said:566 ‘Holy Lamp!567
Behold this mystery is most certainly the mystery,
of: {Deut. 22:10}You shall not plough with an ox and a donkey together.
When the first born568 – which is Israel, the Middle Pillar –
do not bring it the fruit to the house of Y”Y,
then milk becomes mixed with meat,
and it causes the mingling of ox and donkey,
and this is a ‘forbidden-mixture’∞‹∞kilayim›,
of a species with one that is not of its own species.

Deut. 22:10

∞kilayim

Said Rabbi Shimon: Elijah, Elijah!
And yet the ox is from the side of purity,
and the donkey is from the side of defilement.
This is a ‘forbidden-mixture’ of good and evil!569
But milk is from the side of purity,
and meat is also from the side of purity.’570

He said to him: Most certainly, that is how it is.
But this mystery is made known through this verse:
{Gen. 1:24} . . . Let the earth bring forth the ‘living soul’ ∞‹∞nephesh ḥayah›,
of each creature to its species . . .
For even though they are of the side of purity,
they are all male and female,
and they are pairs,
and one who takes from that which is not of his species type
about that subsequent child that is composed of both-of-them,
it is stated: do not cook a kid in its mother’s milk.

Gen. 1:24

∞nephesh ḥayah

Said the holy lamp:
‘Now surely the matter is in its place,
and this is the clarification of the matter.
And this is: {Ex. 22:28}Your ‘fullness’ and your ‘tear’ offerings do not delay . . . 571
And it is said:lxxvii
‘Lest another precede him through mercy or prayer.’572

Ex. 22:28

This sin,573
when a man mingles ‘the drop’ of the firstborn,
through coupling with
‘menstruant maidservant, gentile, whore’,
for this causes another to take his true coupling partner.
And it is ‘measure for measure’.

And therefore:
{Ex. 23:19}The first of the fruits of your land,
you shall bring to house of Y”Y ELoQeYKha . . .
is followed by . . . you shall not cook a kid in its mother’s milk,
because that resulting child is a mixture,
which emerges in a state of forbidden-mixing∞‹∞kilayim›
– from a woman that is not of his type.
For she is described as {Gen. 2:18}against him∞‹∞kenegdo›.

30b

Ex. 23:19

∞kilayim

Gen. 2:18

∞kenegdo

And thus, if he merits, she is his help∞‹∞’ezer›,lxxviii
his partner, she who is his help in Torah,
in precept,574 in fear, and in love,
a ‘help’ for him in this world, and in the world to come.575

∞’ezer

And if not,
but rather another, who is not of his type,
then she is against him,
to make him lose both worlds.
And all of this happened to him
because he did not preserve ‘the first drop’,
for his true female partner.

And nevertheless,
if he returned in repentance,
then about him it is stated:
{Is. 6:10} . . . and he returns and is healed.
And his true female partner is given to him,576
of whom it is stated {Prov. 3:8}It shall be a healing for your navel.
And she is the image of the Torah,
for she is the cure, and she is life.

Is. 6:10

Prov. 3:8

It is this that is written:
{Prov. 3:18}It is a tree of life to those who take hold of it . . .
And his wife is in its the Torah’s image.
It is this that is written: {Ecc. 9:9}See life with the woman you love . . .
This Torah is ‘good’ ∞‹∞tov›.
It is this that is written: {Prov. 4:2}For a good ∞‹∞tov› lesson have I given you . . .
His wife is in its image.577
It is this that is written:
{Prov. 18:22}He who has found a wife has found good ∞‹∞tov› . . .

Prov. 3:18

Ecc. 9:9

∞tov

Prov. 4:2

∞tov

Prov. 18:22

∞tov

Ultimately, ten things are said of one, and ten of the other.
And behold, the companions have established it.

Tiqun Fifteen578 for Day 8579

Gen. 1:1

{Gen. 1:1}In the beginning∞‹∞Be-REiShYT› – this is Israel,
as is written: {Jer. 2:3}Holy is Israel to Y”Y,
the ‘reishyt’ ∞‹∞first› of His produce . . . 580
– ‘first’ without any other admixture.
And because he is holy,
he is not composed of any other type.

∞Be-REiShYT

Jer. 2:3

∞first

And because he Israel is holy,
the fruit the drop requires preservation for his true female partner,
which is the letter Hei‹ה›.
And because of this, the ‘first’ tevu-at ∞‹∞produce of› and the letter ה‹Hei›,
it has no defect.
It is this that is written: {Gen. 25:27}And Jacob was a perfect ∞‹∞tam› man . . .
 – meaning he had no refuse.
[It is required to be preserved for:]
This ‘fruit’ is fit for a King,581
and therefore: {Jer. 2:3} . . . all who eat of it will be rendered guilty,
evil shall come upon them, says Y”Y.

ה

∞produce of Hei

Gen. 25:27

∞tam

Jer. 2:3

For this is the Tree of Life,
Whose fruit is the ‘elixir of life’,
his coupling partner,
preserved for him in this world, and in the world to come.
About her it is stated: {Gen. 3:22} . . . and he shall also take from the tree of life,
and shall eat and live forever.
The word “also” comes to include his coupling partner,
his elixir of life
– which is preserved for him in this world,
and in the world to come.
And any other one who wishes to take his partner,
Like Uriah who preceded David,582
it is stated of him: {Jer. 2:3} . . . all who eat of it will be rendered guilty,
evil shall come upon them, says Y”Y.

Gen. 3:22

Jer. 2:3

For the female partner of the righteous man,
is a ‘guarded∞‹∞shmurah›, unleavened-bread’,
in relation to a ‘complete∞‹∞shleimah›, rich, unleavened-bread’.583

∞shmurah

∞shleimah

And what caused this,
that his female partner became his ‘guarded’ unleavened bread∞‹∞matzah›?
It is because he guarded his drop.
And of one who defiles his drop,
his female partner is called a ‘broken∞‹∞perusah› unleavened bread’,
‘the bread of poverty’.584

∞matzah

∞perusah

And the mystery of the matter:
anyone who belittles ‘the bread’,
or the breadcrumbs,585
which are as the drops of an olive,lxxix
[Var. in which there is like the measure of an olive]586
then poverty pursues him.lxxx 587
Rather, one needs to preserve his drops,
so as not to throw them in an unnecessary place.

And thus did the Masters of the Mishnah establish:lxxxi
‘Respect your wives that you may become wealthy’,
and respecting them is preserving the first drop
– so that refuse is not made of it.

For the ‘refuse’ of Abraham and Isaac,
caused the nations of Esau and Ishmael,
who enslaved their children in exile,
– though their Abraham and Isaac’s trial through fire and knife,
saved them their descendants from their burning and killing.

And of Jacob,588 because there was no ‘refuse’ in him,
it is said of his seed in exile: {Deut. 33:28}And Israel shall dwell securely alone,
the abode 589 of Jacob . . .
It is stated here: securely alone ∞‹∞badad› . . .
and it is stated there, of the redemption from exile:
{Deut. 32:12}Y”Y alone ∞‹∞badad› will lead him, and there is no foreign god with Him.

Deut. 33:28

∞badad

Deut. 32:12

∞badad

There will be no mingling in his children,
of the mixture of conversions,
and thus
‘there is no receiving of proselytes in the messianic age.’lxxxii
For upon the seed of Jacob it is stated:
{Ps. 80:9}You brought out a vine from Egypt . . .
Just as the vine does not accept grafting from any other species,
so his seed have been guarding the sign of the covenant,
they do not accept grafting from any other species.

Ps. 80:9

And all who guard the sign of the covenant are worthy of royalty,

as in the case of Joseph.

31a

And the People of Israel,
because they have guarded the covenant,
have therefore merited the kingdom.
And it is stated of them:lxxxiii
‘All of Israel are the children of Kings’.
And of Moses, because he guarded the sign of the covenant,
it is stated: {Deut. 33:5}And there was a king in Jeshurun . . . 590
Worthy is he who guards the covenant!

Deut. 33:5

Tiqun Sixteen591

Be-REiShYT∞‹∞In the beginning› – this is ḥallah,592
it is this that is written: {Num. 15:20}Of the ‘first’ ∞‹∞reishyt› of your dough,
‘a loaf’ ∞‹∞ḥallah› you will offer as an offering . . .
For behold they the sages have established:lxxxiv
‘Adam was the ḥallah∞‹∞‘loaf’› of the world.’
And from where do we derive that ḥallah is ‘reishyt’∞‹∞first›?
For scripture proves it 593 – it is this that is written:
. . . the ‘first’ ∞‹∞reishyt› of your dough, ‘a loaf’ ∞‹∞ḥallah› . . .
you shall offer as an offering {to Y”Y}.

∞In the beginning

Num. 15:20

∞reishyt

∞ḥallah

∞‘loaf’

∞first

∞reishyt ∞ḥallah

to Y”Y

What is ‘ḥallah’?
But there are seven species:594
{Deut. 8:8}wheat, and barley, and the vine,
and the fig, and the pomegranate, a land of olive oil,
and honey – which is date honey.

Deut. 8:8

ḤiTaH∞‹∞wheat› is the ‘tree’ from which the first man ate,lxxxv 595
and he did not remove ḥallah from there.
Therefore, the letter Hei‹ה› did not ‘occur’∞‹∞ḥal› upon it,
but only Ḥet∞‹∞sin›‹ח› and Tet‹ט› resided upon it
– and this caused his death.596

∞wheat

ה ∞ḥal

∞sin ח ט

And ḥallah is the Shekhinah,
comprised of these seven species,
and, through it ḥallah did the first man sin.
The ‘drop’ is Yod‹י›.
Ḥallah must be removed from dough,
and then immediately it ‘occurs’∞‹∞ḥal› upon that drop,
and gives it seed comprised of both-of-them,
which is Vav‹ו›.
And the mystery of the matter: {Gen. 47:23}Behold ∞‹∞Hei›! You have seed!

י

∞ḥal

ו

Gen. 47:23

∞Hei

And therefore, separation of ḥallah, specifically,
is a precept commanded to a woman,
for because of her died Adam,
who was ‘the ḥallah of the world’.

She therefore is required to separate ‘a loaf’∞‹∞ḥallah›,
and to extract it from her ‘dough’,
which is her drop,
to return it upon Adam.

∞ḥallah

She extinguished597 [Var. extinguished] his candle,
of which it is stated: {Prov. 20:27}The candle of Y”Y is the soul of man . . .
therefore She is required to light it on Sabbath eve;lxxxvi
in arousal of the flames of ‘the fire of love’,598
towards her husband.599
And the mystery of the matter:
{Song. 8:7}Many waters cannot extinguish the love . . .

Prov. 20:27

Song. 8:7

And the arousal of heat on Sabbath eve, from his wife,
needs to be with love and fear,
and this is: {Lev. 12:2} . . . a woman, when she shall conceive,
and give birth to a son . . . 600

Lev. 12:2

She is ‘the spilling of blood’ of Adam,601
therefore her blood is dispersed,
and because of [all] this, she needs to protect him,
from menstrual blood.

And therefore:lxxxvii
on these three things are women to be careful:
in the laws pertaining to menstrual separation,602
and separation of ḥallah,
and in the lighting of the Sabbath candle.

Until here: the mystery of wheat; from where ḥallah is separated.
ḤiTaH∞‹∞wheat› ‹r22› is the mystery of the twenty-two letters of the Torah.

∞wheat r22

Tiqun Seventeen,603 for Day 9

Gen. 1:1

{Gen. 1:1}Be-REiShYT∞‹∞In the beginning›:
Upon that it is stated: based upon604 Deut. 18:4
The reishyt ∞‹∞first› of the tithing ∞‹∞ma’aser› of your grain . . . [Var. your produce]
And this is the sephirah of Malkhut, which is ma’aser ∞‹∞tithing›,
and it is ‘the tenth’ of the ten sephirot,
and because of Her there is tithing.

∞In the beginning

∞first ∞ma’aser

∞tithing

And ‘husk and straw’,605
which are the ‘garments’ of wheat in this world,
are exempt from tithing.606
And whoever wishes to extract a tithe from wheat,
needs to clean it of ‘husk and straw’ –
which are Ḥet-Tet‹חט›
– and She remains, the ‘clean’ Hei‹ה›.
And then,607 he will shoot into her a drop,
which is Yod‹י› [O-D‹וד›].

ח־ט

ה

י וד

And similarly, in human coupling,
one needs to clean the drop from sin∞‹∞ḥet›,
which is the evil inclination,
to become a clean seed,
with Hei‹ה›.
It is this that is written: {Gen. 47:23} . . . Behold ∞‹∞Hei›! You have seed!

∞ḥet

ה

Gen. 47:23

∞Hei

But in the world to come,
‘wheat’ is completely clean,
– it and its garment.
And it is the twenty-two letters of the Torah.

Therefore, in the ‘Ha-Motzi ’∞‹∞The Extractor› blessing over bread,608
the master of the house must be scrupulous in pronouncing Ha‹ה›,
that it may be clean, without refuse.

∞The Extractor

ה

And there are two tithings lxxxviii ∞‹∞’issurin›,609
for scripture says: {Deut. 14:22}You shall ‘surely’ tithe ∞‹∞’aser te-’aser›.610
Why?
Rather, because it is to bind Her‹Malkhut› with two arms,
which are the Priest and the Levite,
which are: ‘the first tithing’ to the Levite,
and ‘the tithe of the tithing’ to the Priest.

∞’issurin

Deut. 14:22

∞’aser te-’aser

Malkhut

For all sephirot add up to ten [in the Shekhinah],
until they add up to one hundred by the correction of Malkhut.
And She Malkhut is made into ‘an offering’∞‹∞terumah› for all one hundred.
And because of this, the measure

∞terumah

of the terumah∞‹∞priestly offering› is two parts of one hundred,lxxxix
corresponding to ‘the two tablets of the Torah’,
which is the Torah that was given in forty days,
and this is
TORaH and Mem‹מ›‹40›611 anagram: TeRuMaH.

31b

∞priestly offering

מ 40

And through it‹Malkhut›, all the sephirot are made into ‘tens’.
The three Patriarchs are three ‘tens’,
the ‘two prophets of truth’ Moses and Aaron are:
{Num. 28:21}A tenth,∞‹∞’isaron›, a tenth . . .

Malkhut

Num. 28:21

∞’isaron

[In manuscript, it is written here: Tiqun 23 and 24, and afterwards the 18th Tiqun.]612

Tiqun Eighteen613

614Be-REiShYT∞‹∞In the beginning› [ELQYM created]
is composed of the words BaRA∞‹∞He-created› ShYT∞‹∞six›
– they are the six levels of prophecy,
of which it is stated: {Song. 5:15}His thighs are pillars of ‘shesh’ ∞‹∞marble›∞‹∞six›.

∞In the beginning

∞He-created ∞six

Song. 5:15

∞marble ∞six

And just as there are six below,
so there are six above.
And they are six, ascending to sixty.
In which place?
In YeSoD∞‹∞foundation›‹Yesod› – ‘life force of the worlds’.615

∞foundation Yesod

YaD∞‹∞hand›‹r14› remains from YeSOD
– this is the lower Shekhinah –
comprising fourteen parts of the hand,
which are in the five fingers,
and they are YQV”Q, YOD QE VAV QE
– the fourteen letters of the blessed Holy One,
which are included in Her,
and this is:
{Hos. 12:11} . . . and by ‘hand’ ∞‹∞yad›‹r14› of the prophets, I shall be imagined.616

∞hand r14

Hos. 12:11

∞yad r14

S-O‹66› of YeSOD
– these correspond to ‘the six steps of the throne’,
of which it is stated: {1 King. 10:19}Six levels to the throne.
And the letter Vav‹ו›‹6› ascends,
through Yod‹י›‹r10› which is the crown of the covenant of circumcision,
to sixty.
Six times ten, and amounting to sixty,
correspond to the sixty ‘wheels’617 which surround the throne.
And the throne there is the Shekhinah,
which is the ‘image’ and ‘appearance’∞‹∞mar-eh› of all.

66

1 King. 10:19

ו 6

י r10

∞mar-eh

Image∞‹∞dimyon› is that which has been stated:
. . . and by the hand of the prophets I shall be imagined ∞‹∞adameh›.
And upon that it is stated:
{Num. 12:8} . . . and the depiction618 of Y”Y he will behold.

∞dimyon

∞adameh

Num. 12:8

Because all the countenances619 of the prophets,
are inscribed in it‹Malkhut›,
it is called dimyon ∞‹∞imagination›.620

Malkhut

∞imagination

And because all the lights which are above it‹Malkhut› are seen through it,
it is called mar-eh∞‹∞appearance›.
It is this that is written:
{Num. 12:6} . . . Y”Y, in appearance∞‹∞mar-eh›, I shall become known to him.

Malkhut

∞appearance

Num. 12:6

∞mar-eh

With eyes shut,621 it is called ‘appearance in a dream’.
And the mystery of the matter: {Song. 5:2}I am asleep, but my heart is awake . . .
And with eyes open it is ‘a waking appearance’.

Song. 5:2

And there are two who are appointed there:
one is Sagro”n, and one is Patḥo”n.622
And Metatro”n, who is called by the name of both-of-them,623
is appointed over these two keys.

From the aspect of the Middle Pillar‹Tipheret›,
the Shekhinah is ‘a waking appearance’.
And Moses was of this aspect,
since it is written of him: {Num. 12:8} . . . mouth to mouth I shall speak with him,
and with appearance and not with riddles,
and the depiction of Y”Y will he behold.

Tipheret

Num. 12:8

From the aspect of the Righteous One ∞‹∞tzadiq›‹Yesod›,
which is ‘the light hidden for the righteous’ for the world to come [Var. for the future],
it is called ‘a vision in a dream’,
– and that is what is seen through it.624

∞tzadiq Yesod

From the aspect of the body, it is YQVQ,
the Middle Pillar,
which is taken from two sides.

And it rides upon four ḥayot which are:
the face of a human,
the face of a lion,
the face of an ox,
the face of an eagle.
YOD QE VAV QE ‹45› is called the interior of the body,
and it is the ‘human’∞‹∞adam› sitting upon the throne.

45

∞adam

To one who is of the level of ‘human’,
it prophecy appears to him in ‘the image of man’.
To one who is like the other angelic-beasts625 of the Chariot,
it appears to him in the image of the ḥayot of the throne,
– each one according his strength.

Jer. 9:22–3

{Jer. 9:22–3}And let not the boaster boast . . . of perceiving it,626
but all is seen through His Shekhinah.
For no prophet or seer can comprehend it,
except through the Shekhinah.

And there is ‘a human’ higher than ‘human’,627
from the aspect of Ḥokhmah,
comprised of] Ko-aḤ∞‹∞power›‹r28› and MaH∞‹∞what›‹45›, specifically.
And it is stated of it:xc
‘a wise man∞‹∞ḥakham› is more preferred than a prophet’.

∞power r28 ∞what 45

∞ḥakham

Arose Rabbi Shimon with all the companions and said:

‘Faithful shepherd! Master of all prophets!628
Arise! Be aroused from your sleep!
For you are among the prophets, like the sun,xci
from which the moon and the planets shine.
And they have no light from ‘the other side’.629
And when you were gathered from the world,
it is stated of them: {Job 3:9}May the stars of its twilight 630 be darkened . . .

Job 3:9

Arise! Shine lights! [Var. your light!]

And not only that:
but at the time you were gathered from the world,
‘the house of prophecy’ – of which it is stated:
{Num. 12:7}Not so my servant Moses, in all My ‘house’ he is faithful
 – it is shut.

Num. 12:7

Arise! Open it!
For it is the supernal house,
treasure of all the hidden treasures631 above,
the concealments [Var. sealed things]
of the King Most High632 are there.
And you were like a ‘son of the house’
– a son of that house.

BaYiT∞‹∞house› is composed of:
Beiyt‹ב› – Higher633 Mother‹Binah›,

∞house

ב Binah

Higher Mother‹Binah›,
Yod‹י› – Ḥokhmah – Father,
Tav‹ת› – Tipheret, a ‘son of the house’634 above
– and you were in its image.

32a

Binah

י

ת

For in that [Var. for to this] house,
no prophet or seer has permission,
to enter there except by permission.

And yet you would enter without permission,
like the son of the king,
for whom no gate there is closed.

And not only that,
but other prophets would not enter to see the King,
except at specified hours and certain days,
as we find with Aaron, who was higher than all the others,
that it is stated of him:
{Lev. 16:2} . . . and he shall not come at just any time to the sacred . . .
but rather: {Lev. 16:3}In ‘this’ ∞‹∞zot›‹Malkhut›635 shall Aaron come to the sacred . . .
How much more so, others!
And yet you, at any hour and on any day that you wished,
would enter to see the King.636

Lev. 16:2

Lev. 16:3

∞zot Malkhut

And not only that,
but all other prophets,
would see [Var. comprehend] their prophecy
through the limbs of the King,
each one through a known limb and not more –
some of them through the head of the King,
some through the hairs of the head,
which are numberless stars, and constellations,
some of them through the eyes,
some of them through the ears,
some of them through the face,
some of them through the nose,
some of them through the mouth,
some of them through the neck,
some of them through the hands,
some of them through ‘the stature’637 – which is the body,
some of them through the thighs,
some of the through the sign of the covenant,
some of them through the garments of the King,
– for they have no permission to look further.

But Moses,
through every limb and through every place,
would comprehend his prophecy.
And through every limb would She‹Malkhut› descend towards him,
which was not the case with any of the other prophets.

Malkhut

For each would ascend to his own limb,
because his soul was an emanation638 from that limb,
and that limb was ‘his father’.

And the daughter of the King,
She is the chamber, of each-and-every limb,
the precept∞‹∞mitzvah› of each-and-every limb.639

∞mitzvah

ADNY is the same numerical value as HeYKhaL∞‹∞chamber›‹65›,
and because of this [Var. because of Her], it is stated:
{Ps. 51:17}ADNY! Open my lips . . .

∞chamber 65

Ps. 51:17

YQV”Q is in each-and-every limb,
ADNY is the chamber [YQV”Q is in each-and-every chamber],
and it is ‘the prophetic experience’640 of each-and-every limb,
it is called ‘the appearance’∞‹∞mar-eh› of each-and-every limb.

∞mar-eh

And each-and-every limb has [Var. is called]
a particular sephirah.641

The chamber of all of them is the lower Shekhinah ADNY.
And many appointed ones,
guardians of the gates, they are, to the chamber,
for no prophets can enter there except by permission.

Arise faithful shepherd! Arise open the chamber!
For many masters of prophecy are knocking,
on the gates of the chamber and saying:
“ADNY open my lips . . . ”
And it is shut for them.
Until you arrive there, She does not open.

It is likened to a King,
whose servants and ministers642 required him,
and appointees and rulers of the land sought to appear with him,
each one according to his requirements,
and each one according to his specific rule,
and each one according to his specific occupation.
What did the King do?
He placed everything in the hands of the queen, and he said:
‘Anyone who wants to ask a request, shall come to the Queen,
Who is My ‘house’, the house of Yod‹י›
[Var. [BaYiT∞‹∞house› is BaT∞‹∞daughter› and Yod‹י›],
– My chamber.’
And this is:643 {Jer. 9:22–23}Let not the boaster boast,
. . . of understanding, knowing me . . .
except through ‘this’ ∞‹∞zot› . . .

י

∞house ∞daughter י

∞zot

for over there is Sagro”n who closes,
and over there is Patḥo”n who opens.
Immediately, the Faithful Shepherd arrives,
and he says: ADNY! Open my lips . . .

has become the head of the corner.

∞zot

Song. 7:6

When She ascends towards the King,
many angels and many souls ascend with Her,
which are Her ‘hairs’,
which hang from Her like grapes in a cluster.

And many angels and souls illuminate before Her,
which are called: {Prov. 15:3} . . . the eyes of Y”Y.
And about them it is stated:
{Job 34:21}For His eyes are upon the ways of man . . .

Prov. 15:3

Job 34:21

And many fulfilled precepts ascend before Her,
through all of which She is called:
{Ps. 19:9} . . . the precept ∞‹∞mitzvah› of Y”Y is pure, enlightening the eyes.

Ps. 19:9

∞mitzvah

And many angels ascend with Her,
which are called the ‘ears of Y”Y’,
who are appointed over the voices of prayers,
and over human conversation,
to hear prayers.

And many angels ascend with Her,
that are called ‘the face of Y”Y’,
of whom it is stated: {Ez. 1:10}And the image of their faces,
the face of a human∞‹∞adam› etc.
– shining with many colours.

Ez. 1:10

∞adam

And many angels ascend with Her,
that are called ‘spirits’∞‹∞ruḥin› and ‘fires’,
of whom it is stated: {Ps. 104:4}He makes winds∞‹∞ruḥot› His messengers,
His servants are a blazing fire,
[Var. they are] that are appointed
over the scent and smoke653 of sacrifices,
and they are the ‘masters of the nose’.

∞ruḥin

Ps. 104:4

∞ruḥot

And many ‘masters of voices and speech’ of the mouth,
ascend with Her,
of whom it is stated:
{Ecc. 10:20} . . . for the bird of the heavens shall carry the voice,
and those with wings shall tell a word.

Ecc. 10:20

And many ‘masters of the neck’ ascend with Her,
for it is there that are ‘windpipe and oesophagus’,654
which are appointed over sacrifices and prayers [Var. of prayers],
of which it is stated: {Num. 28:2}My offering, My bread for My ‘fires’ ∞‹∞ishaiy› . . .
and these are called ‘fires’∞‹∞ishiym›.

Num. 28:2

∞ishaiy

∞ishiym

And many angels ascend with Her that are called ‘masters of hands’,
of whom it is stated: {Ez. 1:8}And the hands of a man beneath their wings . . .

Ez. 1:8

And many ‘masters of the body’ ascend with Her,
of whom it is stated: {Dan. 10:6}And its body like tarshish.655

Dan. 10:6

And many ‘masters of the covenant’ ascend with Her,
of whom it is stated: {Ez. 1:28}Like the appearance of the rainbow . . .
 – and they are the ‘masters of signs’.

Ez. 1:28

And many ‘masters of feet’ ascend with Her,
of whom it is stated: {Ez. 1:7} . . . and their feet, a straight foot . . .

Ez. 1:7

And when He is in Her656 chamber,
all the prophets ascend there and knock at the gates,
and they say: {Ps. 51:17}ADNY! Open my lips . . .

Ps. 51:17

In the first three blessings of prayer,
they make request for their soul,657
to enter through them to be before the Cause of causes,658
for it is there that is the life of the soul.659

The middle blessings of prayer are appointed over requests,
to ask their desires about the needs of the body.

In the last three blessings of prayer,
they receive the response to all requests,
from the King.

And above all of them, the hand writes,
and below all of them, the hand signs.
It is this that is written: {Job 37:7}And by the hand of every man he seals . . .

Job 37:7

A hand writes – the Written Torah, which is to the right,
a hand signs – the Oral Torah, which is to the left.

About the written Torah, which is to the right, it is stated:
{Ex. 14:8} . . . and the Children of Israel came out with a high hand . . .
 – and this is the Middle Pillar,
which is the Torah that was given from the right-hand,
for Ḥokhmah is there.

Ex. 14:8

The Oral Torah,
– where the lower Shekhinah is –
is called ‘mouth’660 from the aspect of the Righteous One.
Because thus does the word peh∞‹∞mouth›‹85›,
add up to the numeric value of the word milah∞∞‹∞word›‹∞circumcision›‹85›,
which is ‘every mouth’.661

∞mouth 85

∞word ∞circumcision 85

And because of this:
And by the hand of every man he seals . . .
And She‹Malkhut› is to the left,
for Higher Mother662 is there,
of whom it is stated: ‘sign us for life!’
And the Righteous One‹Yesod›, because of Her,
is called, ‘the book of life’,

Malkhut

Yesod

as we say:xcii ‘And in the book of life . . . etc.’

33a

Behold the chamber is opening!

Here come the prophets,
the ‘masters of the feet’,
who are knocking at the gate,
and are speaking to he who closes the chamber, Sagro”n,
who is called ADNY – his name is as the name of his Master.xciii 663
They say to him: {Ps. 51:17}‘ADNY, open my lips!
Open the gates of the chamber!’

Ps. 51:17

At that time,
the guardians of the gate664 enter the presence of the King,
and they say to Him:

‘Master of the worlds!
Behold the masters of the feet are knocking at the gate,
they are the ‘emissaries of precept’,665
who stand in ‘the standing prayer’ before you.’

At that time,
He gives them permission to enter.

The Queen,
who is ‘the precept’∞‹∞mitzvah› of the King,
the custodian666 of all precepts,
instructs merit before the King on their behalf,
and says667 to Him:

∞mitzvah

‘Master of the World!
Here are those who stand before You in prayer.
It is necessary to grant them their requests.’

At that time,
a voice goes out towards the masters of the feet and says:
{Ez. 2:1}Son of man! Stand upon your feet and I shall speak with you . . .
Speak with Me of your request,
through the twelve intermediate blessings of prayer,
and it shall be granted to you in the last three blessings!

Ez. 2:1

The Queen gathers his request.

And one is required to return668 three steps backwardsxciv 669
so as not to turn one’s shouldersxcv to the King.

These then exit,
and Sagro״n closes the door after them.

Now, the ‘masters of signs’ are knocking at the entrance, saying:
ADNY! Open∞‹∞Tiphtaḥ› my lips!
Open – this is Patḥo”n.

∞Tiphtaḥ

And these are the masters of the 18∞‹∞ḥaiy› blessings of prayer,
from the aspect of the ‘life-force∞‹∞ḥaiy› of the worlds’,
who unite the blessed Holy One and the Shekhinah there,
for the Righteous One‹Yesod› 670 is the ninth,
from above to below, and from below to above.671

∞ḥaiy

∞ḥaiy

Yesod

Nine vowel points: nine cantillation notes.
And about them it is stated: {Gen. 1:17}And ELQYM placed them,
in the firmament of the heavens . . .
 – and this is the Righteous One in which are all vowel points,
. . . to illuminate the earth . . .
 – this is the Shekhinah – Who is comprised of all letters.

Gen. 1:17

672Immediately, the ‘masters of requests’ knock at the gate.

Many guardians of the gate enter before the King and say:
‘Master of the Universe!
Behold the ‘righteous masters’ – masters of prayer,
who bless you with the 18 blessings,
are seeking to enter before You.

Immediately,
He instructs to open for them, and to grant its the group’s request.

And these are the ‘masters of the signs’,
from the aspect of those of whom it is stated:
{Gen. 1:14} . . . and they shall be for ‘signs’ and seasons,
and for days and for years.

Gen. 1:14

And these are they who worship on their knees,
through the ‘life-force of the worlds’,
[all] with eighteen blessings towards the Shekhinah.673

These then exit.

Then the ‘masters of the stature’ are knocking at the entrance,
those who are kneeling and worshiping the King in prayers.
As they have said:xcvi
‘All who bend the knee, bend the knee at ‘Blessed’,
and all who stand straight, stand straight at the Name.’

One bends the knee in relation to ADNY,
through the Righteous One,
of which it is stated: {1 King. 2:45}And King Solomon is ‘blessed’ . . .
And one stands up straight in relation to YQV”Q,
to join the two-of-them together,
like this: Y-A-Q-D-V-N-Q-Y.

1 King. 2:45

And upon all of them does the Shekhinah instruct merit.

And these, when their souls ascend above,
many angels receive them upon their wings, and elevate them,
to the gate of the chamber of the King.

As soon as they knock at the entrance,
they instruct merit before the King on their behalf,
and the King instructs to open for them.
And these are they that utter silently674 before the King,
and ask from him their requests in silence.
They are ‘individuals’ 675 before the King,
and the King grants them their requests.

Immediately:
the Queen takes hold of them,
and instructs merit on their behalf
before they exit from the chamber,
and She says:

‘Master of the Universe!
These are they who cover me,
with the wrapping of the precept of tzitzit,
with five knots and thirteen ‘segments’ 676 on each side,
and with thirty-two ‘branches’ of the precept.677

Immediately:
The blessed Holy One instructs the angels of the supernal chariot,
to take them on their wings,
and to fly with them from place to place,
and to shield them, from all damaging forces and harmful angels.

These then exit and others are knocking at the gate.

Immediately:
the guardians of the gates enter and say:

‘Master of the Universe!
‘The masters of the hands’,
who bind the phylactery of the hand,
upon their left arms in prayer,
and phylacteries upon the head,
are desirous of entering.’

And these are they who give a gift678 to You with the right-hand,
which is TZeDaQaH∞‹∞charity›.
Tzadi‹צ›‹90› stands for ninety times amen,
Dalet‹ד›‹4› stands for four liturgical recitations of ‘Sanctity’∞‹∞qedusha›,679
Quph‹ק›‹r100› stands for one hundred blessings,680
Hei‹ה›‹5› stands for five books of the Torah,

∞charity

צ 90

ד 4 ∞qedusha

ק r100

ה 5

– and immediately, He instructs them to open for them.

At that

time,
and the ‘hands of a man’681 emerge,
which are Gedulah‹Ḥesed› and Gevurah,
and they receive their gift.

33b

Ḥesed

It is this that is written:
{Ez. 1:8}And the hands of a ‘man’ ∞‹∞adam› from beneath their wings . . .
What is “man”?
He of whom it is stated:{Is. 44:13} . . . like the glory∞‹∞tipheret› of a man . . .

Ez. 1:8

∞adam

Is. 44:13

∞tipheret

And they accept the present from them,
and they give it to the King.
And if the gift is not fitting,
it is handed to ‘the dog’,
and their request is rejected [Var. for them] to the outside.

For there are those for whom the gates do not open,
and it is stated of them: {Deut. 24:11}Outside you shall stand . . .
And the King speaks with them outside,
and grants them their request outside,
and then they go away.

Deut. 24:11

For not everyone enters the house of the King,682
rather only those who are ‘masters of the house’,
of whom it is stated: {Dan. 1:4}Children in whom there was no blemish . . .
 – not in their prayers, and not in their souls,
. . . and of handsome appearance – in all their deeds,
. . . and who understand all wisdom – and are beautiful to behold,
for about them it is stated: {Song. 2:14} . . . show me your appearance,
let me hear your voice,
for your voice is sweet and your appearance beautiful.

Dan. 1:4

Song. 2:14

Dan. 1:4

{Dan. 1:4} . . . and who are erudite in knowledge, and who understand science∞‹∞mad’a›
 – who know in wisdom and understanding∞‹∞te-vunah› and knowledge,
for one does not expound the ‘act of creation,’ xcvii 683
unless he is wise in wisdom∞‹∞ḥokhmah›,
and understands with understanding∞‹∞binah›,
and knows with knowledge∞‹∞da’at›.684

∞mad’a

∞te-vunah

∞ḥokhmah

∞binah

∞da’at

. . . and who have strength∞‹∞ko-aḥ›‹r28› – this is the Higher Shekhinah,
Who is the ko-aḥ ∞∞‹∞28›‹∞power› letters of the act of creation,
to stand through all of them, in the ‘standing’ of prayer.

∞ko-aḥ r28

∞28 ∞power

These shall enter the chamber of the King,
for they are completely righteous.

Ordinary people685 are granted their requests outside,
and they do not enter within.

The wicked are rejected from there,
and they are not granted their requests,
rather, it is stated of them: {Is. 1:12}Who asked this of you,
trampling my courts?

Is. 1:12

And these are the wicked,
who disrespect the King with their prayers,
for they ignore hearing the prayer,686
and they interrupt prayer with mundane conversation.687

These then exit.

And then others enter,
who are ‘masters of the neck’,
who bless the blessed Holy One,
upon the food and drink of sacrifices,
of the offerings which they recite688 every day,
reciting: {Num. 28:2}Command the Children of Israel and say unto them:
My offering, My bread, for My fires, My sweet savour . . .
which they are offering to the blessed Holy One and His Shekhinah,
in the many sacrifices of prayer.
And these are they who have pleasure,689
through the ‘delight∞‹∞’oneg› of the Sabbath’,
and bless the blessed Holy One.
The blessed Holy One grants them their request,
while others, who eat without prayer,690 are rejected from there,
and they are given over to the hand of many harmful angels,
who are damaging forces.691

Num. 28:2

∞’oneg

These then exit.

Now the ‘masters of voices and speech’,
– in hymns and praises and thanksgiving of prayer –
are knocking,
and the ‘masters of voices’,
who call to the blessed Holy One in the recital of the Shm’a:
{Deut. 6:4}Hear O Israel . . . – twice: morning and evening.

Deut. 6:4

Meanwhile,692
the ‘masters of feet’693 are knocking at the entrance
– the masters of the ‘standing’∞‹∞’amidah› of prayer –
of whom it is stated:{Dan. 1:4} . . . and who have the strength to stand,
in the chamber of the King . . .

∞’amidah

Dan. 1:4

The King . . . unspecified694 – this is the blessed Holy One,xcviii
. . . the chamber of the King – this is ADNY,
of which it is stated: ADNY! Open my lips . . .
ADNY‹65› amounts to the numeric of HeYKHaL∞‹∞ chamber ›‹65›.
And it is stated: {Hab. 2:20} . . . and H’ in His holy chamber,
let the whole Earth be silent ∞‹∞hass›‹65› before Him.

65 ∞ chamber 65

Hab. 2:20

∞hass 65

Worthy is he who merits entering the chamber
of the blessed Holy One,
to behold the King and the Queen.695

Worthy is the mouth [which is the ‘chamber’ of YQV”Q]
in which resides prayer
– which is ADNY, to Whom they say: ADNY! Open my lips . . .
And worthy are the lips that are gates to the chamber,
like those of whom it is stated:
{Ps. 118:19}Open for me the gates of righteousness . . .

Ps. 118:19

For when his mouth opens in prayer with the Shekhinah,
then Y”Y answers immediately.
It is this that is written:
{Is. 58:9}Then∞‹∞az› shall you call, and Y”Y will answer . . .
AZ ∞‹∞then›‹8› – eight letters: YQV”Q EQY”Q.
. . . and Y”Y will answer . . . – He and His court of judgement,
and this is: YQV”Q ADNY: Y-A-Q-D-V-N-Q-Y.

Is. 58:9

∞az

∞then 8

Corresponding to these eight letters,
are the [letters] [Var. angelic beings] of the ‘ḥashmal’ ∞‹∞electrum›,696
which are angelic-beings of fire,697
– there is a time they are ‘silent’∞‹∞ḥash›,
and there is a time they are ‘speaking’∞‹∞mal›.
Sitting in prayer they are speaking,
standing in prayer, they are silent.698

∞electrum

∞ḥash

∞mal

[Var. Here belongs the sections “and when a man prays” on p. 34]699

And come and see:
If a person elevates,
in his thought, through his prayer,
the Shekhinah,
or through each and any precept that he performs,
[Var. And come see: in prayer through which elevates the Shekhinah,
or in any precept in which elevates the Shekhinah]
then as soon as he knocks
at the entrance of the chamber of the King,
whether he be prophet, or seer, or sage,
or a righteous person or a pious person,
then, as soon as he calls at the gate,
if the Shekhinah has ascended there,
then shall YQVQ immediately answer.
And He does not wait for any servant or any appointee,
to open for him,
but He Himself actually opens for him,
from the affection and love that He has towards Her,
like a groom towards a bride.

But if the Shekhinah has not ascended,
in that prayer or precept,
then the blessed Holy One does not consider it sufficient,
to open His chamber for him,
even by means of an agent.700

And he is not worthy of entering the chamber of the King,
and about him it is stated: {Deut. 24:11}Outside shall you stand . . .
And from outside, they grant him his request,
by means of an emissary or appointed one.

34a

Deut. 24:11

And if his prayer does not ascend appropriately,
they expel him to the outside, and they shut the door in his face.
And about that is stated:
{Prov. 1:28}Then shall they call me,701 but I shall not answer,
they will seek me out early, but they will not find me.

Prov. 1:28

And so it is, when each-and-every individual of Israel
calls to the blessed Holy One,
through the recitation of the Shm’a, or in prayer,
or through any precept,
if the Shekhinah is not there,
then He does not descend there.

It is this that is written:702
{Ex. 20:24} . . . in every place where I cause mention of my Name,
I shall come to you and bless you.
And Onqelos translated this to mean:
‘in every place that ‘My Presence’∞‹∞Shekhinti› resides, there . . . etc.’

Ex. 20:24

∞Shekhinti

For when a person elevates the Shekhinah,
through his performance of precepts,
towards the blessed Holy One,
then the blessed Holy One descends upon him, for Her sake.
And because of this, the prophet said: {Jer. 9:22–23}Let not the boaster . . . etc.
. . . except in ‘this’ ∞‹∞zot›‹Malkhut›703 . . .
and thus, they have established it.

Jer. 9:22–23

∞zot Malkhut

[And so it is, when a person elevates the Shekhinah,
through his prayer, towards the blessed Holy One,
then the blessed Holy One descends to receive his prayer,
and His Shekhinah precedes Him]
704[Var. and so also, when a person
causes the blessed Holy One to descend,
through his prayer, towards the Shekhinah,
then Shekhinah immediately proceeds]
to open for him. It is this that is written:
{Gen. 24:15}And it was, before he had finished speaking,
and behold Rebecca emerged . . .

Gen. 24:15

And this is the mystery that the sages of the Mishnah established:xcix
‘If the prayer is fluent in my mouth, then I know that it is accepted,
and if not, then I know that it is ‘torn-up’705
– and they tear up his prayer in his face.

And because of this: And it was, before he had finished speaking
– and to utter his prayer in the Name of YQV”Q –
then immediately, the Shekhinah706 emerged towards him,
[Var. to receive him],
and because of him, the Shekhinah descended to his feet.
It is this that is written: {Ps. 85:14}Righteousness shall go707 before him,
and shall place his steps ∞‹∞pe’amav› upon the way.

Ps. 85:14

∞pe’amav

And when the Shekhinah stands upon Israel
– and Israel are the ‘feet’∞‹∞regel› upon which She stands in exile708 –
then the blessed Holy One praises Her through them:
{Song. 7:2}How beautiful are your ‘steps’ ∞‹∞phe-’amayikh› in shoes . . . etc.

∞regel

Song. 7:2

∞phe-’amayikh

And furthermore:
How beautiful are your steps . . .
when Israel fulfil ritual pilgrimage – three times∞‹∞pe’amim› a year.709

∞pe’amim

And furthermore:
How beautiful are your steps∞‹∞phe-’amayikh› in shoes . . .
refers to when Israel stood at Mount Sinai,
about which it is stated: {Zech. 14:4}And his feet shall stand on that day . . . 710

∞phe-’amayikh

Zech. 14:4

And furthermore:
{Song. 7:2}How beautiful are your steps in shoes . . .
When they stand on the New Year,
on the Day of Judgement, in prayer,
then the blessed Holy One, because of them,
stands-up from the ‘Throne of Judgement’,
and sits upon the ‘Throne of Mercy’.c

Song. 7:2

When they Israel stand with the Shekhinah in exile,711
and they suffer for its sake712
so many judgements and many afflictions,
that they say: {Ps. 44:23}Because for Your sake we are killed all the day,
we are considered as sheep for the slaughter.

Ps. 44:23

And when a person prays,
he needs firstly, to cause the blessed Holy One to descend
– Who is YQV”Q –
through the recitation of the Shm’a.

And it is to Him, that we say “Hear O Israel”
on all Sabbaths and festivals.
Because on weekdays, the inner gate of the chamber is shut.
It is this that is written: {Ez. 46:1}Thus said Y”Y ELQYM:
the gate of the inner court, facing eastward,
shall be closed for the six days of work . . .

Ez. 46:1

And why?
Because Metatron rules over it,
and on the Sabbath day, when Her Husband arrives,
it shall open,
and similarly, on the ‘day of the new moon’ it shall open.

And because of this, when a person causes YQV”Q to descend,
through the recitation of the Shema,
he needs to cause It to descend through ADNY,
which is in his mouth.713
And because of this: {Ps. 51:17}ADNY! Open my lips,
and my mouth shall declare your praise.

Ps. 51:17

For there are three prayers on the Sabbath,
and the fourth is ‘the additional prayer’:714
the evening prayer: ‘You have sanctified . . . ’ci
– and this is the lower Shekhinah,
which is from the left side, for the Levites are there,
of whom it is stated: “And you shall sanctify the Levites . . . ” 715

The morning prayer:
‘Moses shall rejoice in the giving of his portion . . . ’cii
– and this is the ‘soul of all life’, ciii716
which is Higher Mother.717
About Her it is stated: {Ps. 68:14}‘If’ ∞‹∞im› you lie down between the ‘borders’ . . . 718
Do not read im ∞‹∞if›, but eim∞‹∞mother›,
about Whom it is stated {Gen. 28:11}vayish-KaV ∞‹∞and he lay›‹r22›,
– in the place where the 22∞‹∞K-V› letters of the Torah are,719
there She lies down.

Ps. 68:14

∞im

∞if ∞mother

Gen. 28:11

∞and he lay r22

∞K-V

Worthy is that mouth of Torah,
for at that hour She is lying-down there.

The third prayer:
‘You are One and Your Name is One’civ
– this is YQV”Q,
the Middle Pillar that unites both-of-them.

And these prayers are:
‘extra soul∞‹∞neshamah›,
and extra spirit’∞‹∞ru-aḥ›,
and ‘extra animating-soul∞‹∞nephesh›.’720
‘Extra animating-soul’ is on Sabbath eve:721 ‘You have sanctified’.cv
‘Extra soul’ is the ‘soul of all life’ cvi
– of which it is stated:
‘Moses will rejoice in the giving of his portion’.cvii
‘Extra spirit’ is ‘You are One, and Your Name is One’.cviii

∞neshamah

∞ru-aḥ

∞nephesh

Worthy is he who opens his mouth in three prayers,
to receive

them the extra souls on the Sabbath.

34b

The ‘additional service’∞‹∞musaph› – this is the Righteous One‹Yesod›,
that includes all prayers.
And it is in the additional prayer that they say:
‘A Crown∞‹∞keter› they give to you Y”Y ELoQeYNU . . . ’cix

∞musaph Yesod

∞keter

And the ‘crown’ is Higher Keter,
Y”Y ELoQeYNU is Father and Mother,
{Is. 6:3}Holy, holy, holy . . . – the three Patriarchs,
Y”Y of Hosts – the covenant of circumcision,
and the two ‘thighs of truth’‹Netzaḥ-Hod›,722
. . . the Earth is full of His glory – this is the Shekhinah.

Is. 6:3

Netzaḥ-Hod

Worthy are the lips that are gates of the chamber,
to receive through them these prayers,
and because of this: {Ps. 51:17}ADNY! Open my lips . . .

through His Shekhinah,
then immediately: {Is. 58:9}Then∞‹∞az› you shall call and Y”Y will answer . . .

– Father and Mother,
And Y”Y shall answer . . . immediately!
